meanings.definition: Relating to a congregation or assembly of people.
meanings.sent1: The congregational choir sang beautifully at the church service.
meanings.sent2: The congregational gathering was filled with joy and laughter.
meanings.sent3: The congregational picnic was a fun way for everyone to come together.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a congregational beacon of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The congregational spirit of unity was palpable in the room.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a form of church government in which each congregation is independent and self-governing.
meanings.sent1: The congregational church made decisions as a group during their meetings.
meanings.sent2: In a congregational system, each church has its own autonomy.
meanings.sent3: The congregational council had a lively debate about the church budget.
meanings.sent4: The congregational structure allowed for flexibility and local control.
meanings.sent5: The congregational leadership model empowered each member to contribute.
